citation.article-title: Sterolibacterium denitrificans gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel cholesterol-oxidizing, denitrifying member of the beta-Proteobacteria.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sterolibacterium denitrificans sp. nov.
Sterolibacterium denitrificans (de.ni.tri′fi.cans. N.L. part. adj. denitrificans denitrifying).
Cells are 1·0–1·3×0·5–0·6 μm in size and are motile by a single polar flagellum.
Optimal pH and temperature for growth are 7·0 and 30–32 °C, respectively.
Temperature and pH ranges for growth are 15–35 °C and 5·8–8·0, respectively.

Carbon sources used include cholesterol (5-cholesten-3β-ol), 4-cholesten-3-one, 5α-androstane-3,17-dione, 4-androstene-3,17-dione, 3β-hydroxy-5α-cholestane, palmitate (C16 : 0) and stearate (C18 : 0).

Neither growth nor nitrate reduction was demonstrated after 6 months with glucose, fructose, xylose, ethanol, lactate, isobutyrate, succinate, malate, crotonate, citrate, laureate, oleate, caproate, heptanoate, cyclohexanol, cyclohexanone, glutamate, leucine, benzoate, phenol, cysteine, dimethylmalonate, desoxycholate or 1,4-androstadiene-3,17-dione.
Doubling time for growth on cholesterol and nitrate is 44–46 h.
The type strain is Chol-1ST (=DSM 13999T =ATCC BAA-354T).
Isolated from a USB denitrifying reactor that treats sanitary landfill leachate in Montevideo, Uruguay.
